editionStmt.funder: Conversion of the printed catalogue to TEI funded by the Warden and Scholars of Merton College.

msDesc.head: ORIGENHOMILIES ON OBOOKS; S. XIII in.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Joshua 9-26, transl. RUFINUS
msItem.incipit: Incipit omelia nona Origenis de altari quod edificauit Iesus
msItem.explicit: ; Post ea quam subuertit Iesus Gai ..
msItem.finalRubric: et ubi est uerus Israel in Christo Iesu d. n. cui .... Explicit de Iesu Naue
msItem.note: CPG 1420; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 30 (1921), pp. 345-463; SChr 71 (1960), pp. 242-500; Stegmüller,Bibl.6181.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Judges, transl. RUFINUS
msItem.incipit: De eo quod scriptum est in libro Iudicum
msItem.explicit: ; Lector quidam lectionis presentis ita legebat ..
msItem.finalRubric: ut ab Ipso uictoriam consequi mereamur in Christo Iesu d. n. cui ..

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homily on I Samuel, transl. RUFINUS
msItem.explicit: ; Non tunc tantummodo Deus plantatuit paradysum ..
msItem.finalRubric: ut in nouitate uite ambulem in Christo Iesu d. n. cui ..
msItem.note: CPG 1423; ed. W. A. Baehrens, GCS 33 (1925), pp. 1-25; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6185.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on the Song of Songs, transl. JEROME
msItem.explicit: ; Quomodo dicimus per Moysen esse quedam non solum sancta sed et sancta sanctorum ..
msItem.finalRubric: ut digni efficiamur sponsi sermone sapiencia Christi Iesu cui ..
msItem.note: CPG 1432; ed. Baehrens, pp. 26-60; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6199; Lambert 206.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Isaiah, transl. JEROME
msItem.explicit: per singula opera et efficeris Filius Dei in Christo Iesu cui ..

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Jeremiah, transl. JEROME
msItem.incipit: Quo tempore Ieremias exorsus est prophetare
msItem.finalRubric: magnificare omnipotentem Deum cum Christo Iesu cui ..
msItem.note: CPG 1438, 1; PL 25. 585-692, with a different prol.; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6205; Lambert 212.

msItem.author: Origen
msItem.title: Homilies on Ezechiel, transl. JEROME
msItem.rubric: Incipit prologus Eusebii Ieronimi in omelias Origenis super Ezechiel numero quattuordecim
msItem.incipit: Magnum est quidem amice quod postulas
msItem.finalRubric: Non omnis qui captiuus est propter peccata ... glorificantes Deum omnipotentem per Iesum Christum cui ..
msItem.note: CPG 1440; SChr 352 (1989), pp. 30-442; Lambert 214; Stegmüller, Bibl. 6208.

physDesc.p: Structure: 155 leaves (ii + 153), 330 × 225 (240 × 155) mm., the edges heavily retrimmed and spattered with red. Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 37 lines. Collation: a singleton, 1-188, 198(8 canc.); the quires numbered at the end, almost all cropped. Binding: As for MS 8, presumably replacing one of s. xvii, resewn on five bands. ff. i-ii, 152-3 are paper binding leaves.

supportDesc.extent:
155 leaves (ii + 153) 330 225
240 155
, the edges heavily retrimmed and spattered with red.
supportDesc.collation: a singleton, 1-188, 198(8 canc.); the quires numbered at the end, almost all cropped.

layoutDesc.layout: Ruled with crayon in 2 cols of 37 lines.

handDesc.handNote: A single early gothic bookhand of middling quality, probably French. Marginal annotation in several hands of s. xv-xvi in.: a neat anglicana of s. xv, the secretary hand of Fitzjames (see below), and at least one other of similar date.

decoDesc.decoNote: On f. 1 is a large (31-line) and handsome initialPin ‘Channel style’, pink, orange and blue with knotwork and interlace, on a gold ground, with red and blue display script. Elsewhere red or blue initials flourished in the other colour. Rubrication by the scribe of the text.

binding.p: As for MS 8, presumably replacing one of s. xvii, resewn on five bands. ff. i-ii, 152-3 are paper binding leaves.

history.provenance: On f. iiv, presumably autograph, ‘Liber magistri Ricardi Fytz James sacre theologie professoris, quem emit 12 die Nouembris anno Christi 1482 precii x s.’; ‘Li 5us’, showing that the book was in a Collegeelectio, and a list of contents,c.1500; in the untidy secretary hand ofc.1500, ‘Origenes super Iosue ex dono domini Ricardi Fitz James nuper Cicestrensis episcopi et custodis istius collegii, cuius anime propicietur Deus Amen’; below this is mounted the former parchment label from the back cover with Fitzjames’ armorial and ‘Origenes super Iosue ex dono domini Ricardi fitz James nuper Cicestrensis episcopi et custodis istius collegii’ (Pl. 34). Richard Fitzjames (BRUO 691-2) was fellow fromc. 1468, warden 1483-1507, bishop of Chichester 1503-6, of London 1506-22. Below again is the College bookplate. At the head of f. 1 is the James no. ‘253’ (recte255), s. xvii. ‘6’ is inked on the foredge. Inside the front board is ‘N. 1. 9.’, canc and replaced by ‘A. 2. 9 (IX)’ in red on the College bookplate.

source.bibl: R. M. Thomson, A descriptive catalogue of the medieval manuscripts of Merton College, Oxford (Cambridge: D. S. Brewer), 2009.
